This patch is a simplified version of the Sprite patch: it renders a quad positioned with only 2 coordinates and which always faces the viewer.
Because of these specificities, Billboard also has several unique features: The width of the quad is set from the "Width" input and its height is computed automatically to preserve the aspect ratio of the image it displays. This image is multiplied by the color set on the "Color" input and can be combined with a mask using the optional "Mask Image" input (the mask will be resized to match the image's size). It has a special "Core Image Direct Rendering" setting that renders images resulting from Core Image filters directly to the destination context, at the highest possible quality. Finally, the rendered quad can be forced to be pixel-aligned, to ensure maximal sharpness.
Note that Billboard is not affected by the environment fog or lighting, and contrary to Sprite, it will not render anything if its "Image" input is not defined.
